definition: to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: You should speak clearly to the men and the groups that timid.
sentences.chinese: 對“怕事”的人或組織要挑明瞭說。

sentences.english: I wish that you would put your cards on the table.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你乾脆把話挑明？

sentences.english: That’s a classic bait-and-switch game, and it may indicate a problem with the company.
sentences.chinese: 這是典型的下套遊戲，挑明瞭這家公司有問題。

sentences.english: Lay your cards on the table regarding your personal direction.
sentences.chinese: 關於你的人生方向，只管把話挑明。

sentences.english: But the longer you leave it the trickier things will become.
sentences.chinese: 你越是不想把事情挑明，事情就會變得越微妙。

sentences.english: Lisa wishes that Gary would put his cards on the table.
sentences.chinese: 薩莉希望加里乾脆把話挑明。

definition: to lay one's cards on the table
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to lay bare in a few words/to expose with a word/to point out bluntly
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
to bring to deadlock/to result in a stalemate
lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
honest/forthcoming/to confess
to be well aware
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
direct and plainspoken (idiom); blunt/straightforward
